intro: Paullinia exalata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Sapindaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, including Brazil, Peru, and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that develop into edible, red berries. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can become invasive in certain areas.
